sentences.english: The shortcomings of China’s medical system are hardly limited to cosmetic and plastic surgery.
sentences.chinese: 中國醫療系統的弊病絕不僅僅侷限於美容整形外科。

sentences.english: Violent crime is only one of the malady afflict modern society.
sentences.chinese: “獨斷論”是當今學術研究的弊病。

sentences.english: With them credit expansion is the panacea for all economic ills.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲信貸擴張是所有經濟弊病的靈丹妙藥。

sentences.english: Part IV states the affects of the Former Qin's minority policies.
sentences.chinese: 論述前秦民族政策的弊病及其影響。

sentences.english: The roadmap includes a measure of self-serving guff about the evils of shareholder democracy.
sentences.chinese: 有關股東民主弊病的利己廢話也赫然出現在路線圖中。

sentences.english: What can be done to solve the problem of unemployment and its ills?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，該採取哪些措施來解決失業問題及其弊病呢？

sentences.english: They believed that better marketing would solve all ills.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲更好的營銷可以解決所有弊病。

sentences.english: He always pontificates about the evils of modern society.
sentences.chinese: 他經常對現代社會的弊病大發議論。

sentences.english: There is a more radical solution that delivers us from modeless dialog maladies.
sentences.chinese: 還有一種更激進的方法可以解決非模態對話框的弊病。

sentences.english: Yet artificial life suffers from the same malaise that afflicts its cousin, artificial intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 然而，人工生命跟它的表親人工智能有着同樣的弊病。

sentences.english: Dogmatism is a malady in the academic research nowadays .
sentences.chinese: “獨斷論”是當今學術研究的弊病。

sentences.english: Fail early, fail often, and don't be afraid to learn from your mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 早掉敗，常掉敗，不要懼怕向本身所犯的弊病學習。

sentences.english: Transparency, management-speak for honesty, is put forward as the answer to most of today's ills.
sentences.chinese: 透明化和誠信管理，是今天大部分弊病的解決之道。

sentences.english: Violent crime is only one of the maladies afflicting modern society.
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪僅危害現代社會的弊病之一。

sentences.english: In his homily the Pontiff focused on the ills of modern materialism .
sentences.chinese: 在演說中，教皇集中批評現代唯物主義的弊病。

definition: to trace something to its source (idiom)
ingrained habits are hard to overcome (idiom); bad old practices die hard
hard lump in the abdomen (in Chinese medicine)/crux of an issue/main point in an argument/sticking point/deadlock in negotiations
(lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap
